contents.text: Google Cloud Platform (GCP) offers a wide range of cloud services to help businesses build, deploy, and scale applications.
Some of the core GCP services include Compute Engine for virtual machines, Cloud Storage for object storage, and BigQuery for data analytics.
GCP provides services for compute, storage, databases, machine learning, networking, and more, allowing users to leverage the power of the cloud for various use cases.
Google Cloud Platform offers a managed Kubernetes service called Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) for containerized applications.
GCP services are designed to be highly scalable, secure, and reliable, making them suitable for enterprises of all sizes.
Navigate to the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) website.
Click on the 'Get Started for Free' button.
Sign in with your Google account or create a new one.
Enter your personal and billing information.
Agree to the terms and conditions.
Provide a valid credit card for verification purposes.
GCP Console Overview
contents.codeSnippet: The Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Console is a web-based interface that allows users to manage their GCP resources and services. It provides a centralized location for accessing and managing various GCP tools and services.

contents.text: Navigating the GCP Console
contents.codeSnippet: To navigate the GCP Console, users can use the left-hand navigation menu to access different GCP services such as Compute Engine, Cloud Storage, BigQuery, and more. Users can also use the search bar to quickly find specific resources or services.

contents.text: Viewing GCP Resources
contents.codeSnippet: Users can view and manage their GCP resources such as virtual machines, databases, storage buckets, and more through the GCP Console. Each resource is organized based on the service it belongs to, making it easy for users to locate and manage their resources.

contents.text: Interacting with GCP Services
contents.codeSnippet: The GCP Console allows users to interact with various GCP services by creating, configuring, and monitoring resources. Users can deploy applications, set up networking configurations, and access logs and monitoring data directly from the console.

contents.text: Managing GCP Projects
contents.codeSnippet: Users can create and manage GCP projects through the GCP Console. Projects help organize resources, control access permissions, and track usage and billing information. Users can switch between projects to work on different environments within the console.

Introduction to GCP Cloud Deployment Manager
contents.codeSnippet: gcloud deployment-manager deployments create example-deployment --config example-config.yaml

contents.text: Benefits of using GCP Cloud Deployment Manager
Creating a Deployment using Deployment Manager
contents.codeSnippet:
resources:
- name: example-instance
  type: compute.v1.instance
  properties:
    zone: us-central1-a
    machineType: zones/us-central1-a/machineTypes/n1-standard-1
    disks:
    - deviceName: boot
      type: PERSISTENT
      boot: true
      autoDelete: true
      initializeParams:
        sourceImage: projects/debian-cloud/global/images/family/debian-9
    networkInterfaces:
    - network: global/networks/default

contents.text: Updating a Deployment using Deployment Manager
contents.codeSnippet: gcloud deployment-manager deployments update example-deployment --config updated-config.yaml

contents.text: Deleting a Deployment using Deployment Manager

Introduction to GCP Cloud Key Management Service

Creating and managing cryptographic keys in GCP Cloud KMS
contents.codeSnippet: gcloud kms keyrings create my-keyring --location global

contents.text: Encrypting and decrypting data using GCP Cloud KMS
contents.codeSnippet: gcloud kms encrypt --location global --keyring my-keyring --key my-key --plaintext-file mydata.txt --ciphertext-file mydata.txt.encrypted

contents.text: Integrating GCP Cloud KMS with other GCP services
contents.codeSnippet: gcloud kms keys add-iam-policy-binding my-key --location global --keyring my-keyring --member serviceAccount:my-service-account@my-project.iam.gserviceaccount.com --role roles/cloudkms.cryptoKeyEncrypterDecrypter

contents.codeSnippet: gcloud dlp inspect content "Hello, my name is John" --info-types=US_SOCIAL_SECURITY_NUMBER

contents.text: Creating Custom InfoTypes for Data Loss Prevention
contents.codeSnippet: gcloud dlp infoTypes create custom "Custom InfoType"

contents.text: Setting up Data Loss Prevention Jobs in GCP
contents.codeSnippet: gcloud dlp jobs create inspect "Job Name" --storage-config="{...}" --inspect-config="{...}"
